availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p: The Committee appointed to decide upon the relative claims to public approval, of the two portraits of Mr Clay submitted to them for their decision, are of opinion that the Portrait drawn by Mr. Fry should be accepted. The Committee was divided in opinion three four being in favor of Mr Fry's portrait and two three in favor of Mr Stantons.

For Mr Fry's portrait --
Jacob Swigert
Philip Swigert
Leslie Combs
Alex S. Trotter

For Mr Santons portrait
George Robertson
John M. Clay
Orlando Brown Sr
